result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm Myron Miller Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Count 1 probation conditions apply to counts 2 and 3.

miscConds.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: - 12 MONTHS condition time with good time credit.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm Myron Miller Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj
Bail Refund packet, Check issued April 14, 2017.
This assessment report shows $4800.00 applied to the case which should have been applied in the original assessment report.

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 12 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 12 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 12 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1-3 and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 12 MONTHS condition time with good time credit.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber and Day Reporting Center.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.  Court will address at next court date.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit, but made up the contact.  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Danielle Chojnacki for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 06/21/2016 is vacated.  As to Counts 1 -3:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Malcolm Myron Miller in court with attorney Patrick James Rupich.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
